member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitHttpClientBase.GetBlobAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: [Preview API] Get a single blob.
member.param: Project ID or project name
The name or ID of the repository.
SHA1 hash of the file. You can get the SHA1 of a file using the "Git/Items/Get Item" endpoint.
If true, prompt for a download rather than rendering in a browser. Note: this value defaults to true if $format is zip
Provide a fileName to use for a download.
If true, try to resolve a blob to its LFS contents, if it's an LFS pointer file. Only compatible with octet-stream Accept headers or $format types
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.summary: [Preview API] Get Item Metadata and/or Content for a single item. The download parameter is to indicate whether the content should be available as a download or just sent as a stream in the response. Doesn't apply to zipped content, which is always returned as a download.
member.param: Project ID or project name
The name or ID of the repository.
The item path.
The path scope. The default is null.
The recursion level of this request. The default is 'none', no recursion.
Set to true to include content metadata. Default is false.
Set to true to include the latest changes. Default is false.
Set to true to download the response as a file. Default is false.
Version descriptor. Default is the default branch for the repository.
Set to true to include item content when requesting json. Default is false.
Set to true to resolve Git HFS pointer files to return actual content from Git HFS. Default is true.
Set to true to sanitize an svg file and return it as image. Useful only if requested for svg file. Default is false.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitHttpClientBase.GetPullRequestIterationChangesAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: [Preview API] Retrieve the changes made in a pull request between two iterations.
member.param: Project ID or project name
The repository ID of the pull request's target branch.
ID of the pull request.

ID of the pull request iteration.
Iteration one is the head of the source branch at the time the pull request is created and subsequent iterations are created when there are pushes to the source branch. Allowed values are between 1 and the maximum iteration on this pull request.
Optional. The number of changes to retrieve. The default value is 100 and the maximum value is 2000.
Optional. The number of changes to ignore. For example, to retrieve changes 101-150, set top 50 and skip to 100.
ID of the pull request iteration to compare against. The default value is zero which indicates the comparison is made against the common commit between the source and target branches
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.summary: [Preview API] Create or update pull request external properties. The patch operation can be `add`, `replace` or `remove`. For `add` operation, the path can be empty. If the path is empty, the value must be a list of key value pairs. For `replace` operation, the path cannot be empty. If the path does not exist, the property will be added to the collection. For `remove` operation, the path cannot be empty. If the path does not exist, no action will be performed.
member.param: Properties to add, replace or remove in JSON Patch format.
The repository ID of the pull requests target branch.
ID of the pull request.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitHttpClientBase.GetPullRequestQueryAsync(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestQuery,System.String,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: [Preview API] This API is used to find what pull requests are related to a given commit. It can be used to either find the pull request that created a particular merge commit or it can be used to find all pull requests that have ever merged a particular commit. The input is a list of queries which each contain a list of commits. For each commit that you search against, you will get back a dictionary of commit -> pull requests.
member.param: The list of queries to perform.
ID of the repository.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

If the reviewer's ID is included here, it must match the reviewerID parameter.

member.summary: [Preview API] Queries the provided repository for its refs and returns them.
member.param: Project ID or project name
The name or ID of the repository.
[optional] A filter to apply to the refs (starts with).
[optional] Specifies if referenceLinks should be included in the result. default is false.
[optional] Includes up to the first 1000 commit statuses for each ref. The default value is false.
[optional] Includes only branches that the user owns, the branches the user favorites, and the default branch. The default value is false. Cannot be combined with the filter parameter.
[optional] True to include only the tip commit status for each ref. This option requires `includeStatuses` to be true. The default value is false.
[optional] Annotated tags will populate the PeeledObjectId property. default is false.
[optional] A filter to apply to the refs (contains).
[optional] Maximum number of refs to return. It cannot be bigger than 1000. If it is not provided but continuationToken is, top will default to 100.
The continuation token used for pagination.
[optional] Includes target branches defined by patterns in pull_request_targets.yml.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.summary: [Preview API] Get statuses associated with the Git commit.
member.param: Project ID or project name
ID of the Git commit.
ID of the repository.
Optional. The number of statuses to retrieve. Default is 1000.
Optional. The number of statuses to ignore. Default is 0. For example, to retrieve results 101-150, set top to 50 and skip to 100.
The flag indicates whether to get only latest statuses grouped by `Context.Name` and `Context.Genre`.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.summary: Convert the byte array to a lower case hex string.

member.summary: Append to as a lower case hex string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitUtils.SafeUnicodeLENoBOM
member.summary: Gets a (without BOM) that throws when decoding invalid byte sequences or encoding unsupported char sequences (Unicode can't encode strings w/ invalid surrogate pair sequences). Use this instead of , which uses a fallback character instead of throwing, which leads to silent corruption.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRepositoryPermissions
member.summary: Defines the permission bitmasks used in the database for git repositories. If modifying, see NOTE at the bottom.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPermissionScope
member.summary: Scopes where can apply.
member.remarks: This enum currently serves 2 purposes: 1. Used by VC Admin UI to determine the GitRepositoryPermissions value that applies to a specific scope and can be changed using the web UI. 2. Used through Git Server to specify a scope to pass to SecurityHelper calls to decide whether an identity has the required access to a resource. Only Project/Repository/Branch apply. FUTURE: We should separate these uses since some scopes are never valid in SecurityHelper calls, and both sets will continue changing for different reasons.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.TfvcCompatHttpClientBase
member.summary: This class contains overloads of methods that were removed from the auto-generated client due to adding parameters. We use extra overloads to ensure that whatever binary signature a client used before will map to one of these prototypes.

[Preview API] Get Item Metadata and/or Content for a single item. The download parameter is to indicate whether the content should be available as a download or just sent as a stream in the response. Doesn't apply to zipped content which is always returned as a download.
member.param: Project ID or project name
Version control path of an individual item to return.
file name of item returned.
If true, create a downloadable attachment.
Version control path of a folder to return multiple items.
None (just the item), or OneLevel (contents of a folder).
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateMode
member.summary: Enumerates the modes under which ref updates can be written to their repositories.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateMode.BestEffort
member.summary: Indicates the Git protocol model where any refs that can be updated will be updated, but any failures will not prevent other updates from succeeding.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateMode.AllOrNone
member.summary: Indicates that all ref updates must succeed or none will succeed. All ref updates will be atomically written. If any failure is encountered, previously successful updates will be rolled back and the entire operation will fail.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus
member.summary: Represents the possible outcomes from a request to update a ref in a repository.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.Succeeded
member.summary: Indicates that the ref update request was completed successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.ForcePushRequired
member.summary: Indicates that the ref update request could not be completed because part of the graph would be disconnected by this change, and the caller does not have ForcePush permission on the repository.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.StaleOldObjectId
member.summary: Indicates that the ref update request could not be completed because the old object ID presented in the request was not the object ID of the ref when the database attempted the update. The most likely scenario is that the caller lost a race to update the ref.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.InvalidRefName
member.summary: Indicates that the ref update request could not be completed because the ref name presented in the request was not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.Unprocessed
member.summary: The request was not processed

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.UnresolvableToCommit
member.summary: The ref update request could not be completed because the new object ID for the ref could not be resolved to a commit object (potentially through any number of tags)

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.WritePermissionRequired
member.summary: The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks write permissions required to write this ref

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.ManageNotePermissionRequired
member.summary: The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks note creation permissions required to write this note

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.CreateBranchPermissionRequired
member.summary: The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks the permission to create a branch

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.CreateTagPermissionRequired
member.summary: The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks the permission to create a tag

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.RejectedByPlugin
member.summary: The ref update could not be completed because it was rejected by the plugin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.Locked
member.summary: The ref update could not be completed because the ref is locked by another user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.RefNameConflict
member.summary: The ref update could not be completed because, in case-insensitive mode, the ref name conflicts with an existing, differently-cased ref name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.RejectedByPolicy
member.summary: The ref update could not be completed because it was rejected by policy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.SucceededNonExistentRef
member.summary:
Indicates that the ref update request was completed successfully, but the ref doesn't actually exist so no changes were made.
This should only happen during deletes.
member.remarks: Core git (and GitHub by extension) returns "warning: Deleting a non-existent ref." in this case as of 3/5/2015

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitRefUpdateStatus.SucceededCorruptRef
member.summary:
Indicates that the ref update request was completed successfully, but the passed-in ref was corrupt - as in, the old object ID was bad.
This should only happen during deletes.
member.remarks: Core git (and GitHub by extension) returns "warning: Allowing deletion of corrupt ref." in this case as of 3/5/2015

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.IdentityRefWithVote.Vote
member.summary:
Vote on a pull request:
10 - approved 5 - approved with suggestions 0 - no vote -5 - waiting for author -10 - rejected

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.IdentityRefWithVote.VotedFor
member.summary:
Groups or teams that this reviewer contributed to.
Groups and teams can be reviewers on pull requests but can not vote directly. When a member of the group or team votes, that vote is rolled up into the group or team vote. VotedFor is a list of such votes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.IdentityRefWithVote.HasDeclined
member.summary: Indicates if this reviewer has declined to review this pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.IdentityRefWithVote.IsRequired
member.summary:
Indicates if this is a required reviewer for this pull request.
Branches can have policies that require particular reviewers are required for pull requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.IdentityRefWithVote.IsFlagged
member.summary: Indicates if this reviewer is flagged for attention on this pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.IdentityRefWithVote.IsReapprove
member.summary: Indicates if this approve vote should still be handled even though vote didn't change.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitTreeDiff.DiffEntries
member.summary:
List of tree entries that differ between the base and target tree.
Renames and object type changes are returned as a delete for the old object and add for the new object.
If a continuation token is returned in the response header, some tree entries are yet to be processed and may yield more diff entries. If the continuation token is not returned all the diff entries have been included in this response.

member.summary: Draft / WIP pull request.

member.summary: Multiple mergebases warning

member.summary: The commit at the head of the source branch at the time of the last pull request merge.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.LastMergeTargetCommit

member.summary: Used internally.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.RemoteUrl
member.summary: Used internally.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.Links
member.summary: Links to other related objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.CompletionOptions
member.summary: Options which affect how the pull request will be merged when it is completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.MergeOptions
member.summary: Options used when the pull request merge runs. These are separate from completion options since completion happens only once and a new merge will run every time the source branch of the pull request changes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.SupportsIterations
member.summary: If true, this pull request supports multiple iterations. Iteration support means individual pushes to the source branch of the pull request can be reviewed and comments left in one iteration will be tracked across future iterations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.WorkItemRefs
member.summary: Any work item references associated with this pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.CompletionQueueTime
member.summary: The most recent date at which the pull request entered the queue to be completed. Used internally.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.ClosedBy
member.summary: The user who closed the pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.AutoCompleteSetBy
member.summary: If set, auto-complete is enabled for this pull request and this is the identity that enabled it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.ArtifactId
member.summary: A string which uniquely identifies this pull request. To generate an artifact ID for a pull request, use this template: ```vstfs:///Git/PullRequestId/{projectId}/{repositoryId}/{pullRequestId}```

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.ForkSource
member.summary: If this is a PR from a fork this will contain information about its source.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequest.IgnoreTargetRefAndChooseDynamically
member.summary: This optional parameter allows clients to use server-side dynamic choices for the target ref. Due to preexisting contracts, users _must_ specify a target ref, but this option will cause the server to ignore it and choose dynamically from the user's favorites (or the default branch).

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestChange
member.summary: Change made in a pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestChange.ChangeTrackingId
member.summary: ID used to track files through multiple changes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThread
member.summary: Represents a comment thread of a pull request. A thread contains meta data about the file it was left on (if any) along with one or more comments (an initial comment and the subsequent replies).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThread.ArtifactUri
member.summary: The artifact uri of the comment thread id. Used for internal server purposes only -- note that this field is not exposed to the REST client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThread.PullRequestThreadContext
member.summary: Extended context information unique to pull requests

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThread.MarkForUpdate
member.summary: Specifies whether a thread is marked for an update operation. Used for internal server purposes only -- note that this field is not exposed to the REST client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThreadContext
member.summary: Comment thread context contains details about what diffs were being viewed at the time of thread creation and whether or not the thread has been tracked from that original diff.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThreadContext.IterationContext
member.summary: The iteration context being viewed when the thread was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThreadContext.TrackingCriteria
member.summary: The criteria used to track this thread. If this property is filled out when the thread is returned, then the thread has been tracked from its original location using the given criteria.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCommentThreadContext.ChangeTrackingId
member.summary: Used to track a comment across iterations. This value can be found by looking at the iteration's changes list. Must be set for pull requests with iteration support. Otherwise, it's not required for 'legacy' pull requests.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentIterationContext
member.summary: Comment iteration context is used to identify which diff was being viewed when the thread was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentIterationContext.FirstComparingIteration
member.summary: The iteration of the file on the left side of the diff when the thread was created. If this value is equal to SecondComparingIteration, then this version is the common commit between the source and target branches of the pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentIterationContext.SecondComparingIteration
member.summary: The iteration of the file on the right side of the diff when the thread was created.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria
member.summary: Comment tracking criteria is used to identify which iteration context the thread has been tracked to (if any) along with some detail about the original position and filename.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria.FirstComparingIteration
member.summary: The iteration of the file on the left side of the diff that the thread will be tracked to. Threads were tracked if this is greater than 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria.SecondComparingIteration
member.summary: The iteration of the file on the right side of the diff that the thread will be tracked to. Threads were tracked if this is greater than 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria.OrigFilePath
member.summary: Original filepath the thread was created on before tracking. This will be different than the current thread filepath if the file in question was renamed in a later iteration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria.OrigLeftFileStart
member.summary: Original position of first character of the thread's span in left file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria.OrigLeftFileEnd
member.summary: Original position of last character of the thread's span in left file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria.OrigRightFileStart
member.summary: Original position of first character of the thread's span in right file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.CommentTrackingCriteria.OrigRightFileEnd
member.summary: Original position of last character of the thread's span in right file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions
member.summary: Preferences about how the pull request should be completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.MergeCommitMessage
member.summary: If set, this will be used as the commit message of the merge commit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.DeleteSourceBranch
member.summary: If true, the source branch of the pull request will be deleted after completion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.SquashMerge
member.summary: SquashMerge is deprecated. You should explicitly set the value of MergeStrategy. If MergeStrategy is set to any value, the SquashMerge value will be ignored. If MergeStrategy is not set, the merge strategy will be no-fast-forward if this flag is false, or squash if true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.MergeStrategy
member.summary: Specify the strategy used to merge the pull request during completion. If MergeStrategy is not set to any value, a no-FF merge will be created if SquashMerge == false. If MergeStrategy is not set to any value, the pull request commits will be squashed if SquashMerge == true. The SquashMerge property is deprecated. It is recommended that you explicitly set MergeStrategy in all cases. If an explicit value is provided for MergeStrategy, the SquashMerge property will be ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.BypassPolicy
member.summary: If true, policies will be explicitly bypassed while the pull request is completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.BypassReason
member.summary: If policies are bypassed, this reason is stored as to why bypass was used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.TransitionWorkItems
member.summary: If true, we will attempt to transition any work items linked to the pull request into the next logical state (i.e. Active -> Resolved)

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.TriggeredByAutoComplete
member.summary: If true, the current completion attempt was triggered via auto-complete. Used internally.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.AutoCompleteIgnoreConfigIds
member.summary: List of any policy configuration Id's which auto-complete should not wait for. Only applies to optional policies (isBlocking == false). Auto-complete always waits for required policies (isBlocking == true).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.Normalize
member.summary: This updates SquashMerge and MergeStrategy so that they agree with each other. MergeStrategy takes precedence.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeOptions
member.summary: The options which are used when a pull request merge is created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeOptions.DisableRenames
member.summary: If true, rename detection will not be performed during the merge.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeOptions.DetectRenameFalsePositives
member.summary: If true, renames where there is more than one valid way to map the original file locations to renamed file locations will be treated as false positives and ignored.
member.remarks: For example, if several identical copies of a file are added/deleted in the same merge.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeOptions.ConflictAuthorshipCommits
member.summary: If true, conflict resolutions applied during the merge will be put in separate commits to preserve authorship info for git blame, etc.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeStrategy
member.summary: Enumeration of possible merge strategies which can be used to complete a pull request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeStrategy.NoFastForward
member.summary: A two-parent, no-fast-forward merge. The source branch is unchanged. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeStrategy.Squash
member.summary: Put all changes from the pull request into a single-parent commit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeStrategy.Rebase
member.summary: Rebase the source branch on top of the target branch HEAD commit, and fast-forward the target branch. The source branch is updated during the rebase operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitPullRequestMergeStrategy.RebaseMerge
member.summary: Rebase the source branch on top of the target branch HEAD commit, and create a two-parent, no-fast-forward merge. The source branch is updated during the rebase operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.SourceControl.WebApi.GitResolution.Author
member.summary: User who created the resolution.
member.remarks:
GitConflict.Resolution.Author is different from GitConflict.ResolvedBy in the same way that author and committer are different for git commits.
The author is included on the resolution object instead of the conflict object so that services can copy a resolution from one conflict instance to another and preserve the original author without needing to know about it.
